title: Bruno Grassi
text:
Bruno Medeiros Grassi (born 5 March 1987) is a Brazilian professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="Paran%C3%A1%20Clube">Paraná</a> as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Football career.
Born in <a href="Tubar%C3%A3o">Tubarão</a>, <a href="Santa%20Catarina%20%28state%29">Santa Catarina</a>, 20-year-old Grassi arrived in Portugal in January 2008 and signed with <a href="C.S.%20Mar%C3%ADtimo">C.S. Marítimo</a> from <a href="Sport%20Club%20Internacional">Sport Club Internacional</a>, along with teammate <a href="Jo%C3%A3o%20Guilherme">João Guilherme</a>. He acted as third-choice during his early years, also playing with <a href="C.S.%20Mar%C3%ADtimo%20B">the reserves</a> in the <a href="Portuguese%20Second%20Division">third division</a>. On 7 December 2008 he made his first-team – and <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a> – debut, conceding all six goals in a 0–6 home loss against <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">S.L. Benfica</a> after starter <a href="Marcos%20Barbosa%20Oliveira">Marcos</a> (his compatriot) was <a href="Ejection%20%28sports%29">sent off</a> in the 18th minute.
For <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Segunda%20Divis%C3%A3o">2009–10</a>, Grassi was loaned to third level side <a href="G.D.%20Tourizense">G.D. Tourizense</a>, being released by the <a href="Madeira">Madeira</a> club at the end of the season and resuming his career in his country's lower leagues. On 22 April 2015 he signed a two-year deal with <a href="Gr%C3%AAmio%20Foot-Ball%20Porto%20Alegrense">Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto Alegrense</a>, initially as a backup to <a href="Marcelo%20Grohe">Marcelo Grohe</a>.
Honours.
Grêmio
